#summary Help & suppor.

one question so far:
= Too many redirects error =

Upon trying to process large onix files you can get this error.
For executing this script from a browser you can replace the serverside redirect with a javascript redirect.

*replace:*

_header("Location: ".$uri."?start=".($end+$start-($deleted+1))."&st=".$st."&totaal=".$totaal);_

*with:*

_?><script type="text/javascript"><!-- window.location = "<?php echo $uri."?start=".($end+$start-($deleted+1))."&st=".$st."&totaal=".$totaal; ?>" //--></script><?php_


If you wish to run this script from a cron then try using a tool that allows you to specify the maximum number of redirects. An example for a unix tool:
_wget --max-redirect=999999 url-to-onix.php_

*or as an alternative you could increase the $mem value.*
